text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the answer to caution the user about checking the platform's Terms and Conditions (T&Cs) for any inadvertent waiver or license granted by the user. The candidate answer addresses this directly in Section 1, stating: \"Posting online (e.g., on your site, Patreon, Webtoon) doesn't waive your rights.\" While it doesn't explicitly say 'check the T&Cs of the platform you posted *to*', it addresses the core concept of whether posting online waived rights, which is the practical implication of T&Cs regarding user-uploaded content. More importantly, in Section 2, when discussing the TDM exception (s.29B), the answer states: \"Many sites ban scraping; if yours did (or you can argue implied license), it's invalid.\" This directly implies the user needs to check the terms/rules of the platform where they uploaded the work to see if scraping was prohibited, which is the necessary step to determine if a license was implicitly or explicitly waived/granted.", "criterion_id": "76fd6711-b3da-40f5-93ef-8652b6002774"}
